docs.snippet: Just over a month after the Parkland mass school shooting, organizers have planned hundreds of demonstrations calling for stricter gun laws.

headline.main: March for Our Lives: Maps of the More Than 800 Protests Around the World

docs.snippet: The remains of 38 Indian construction workers captured and killed by the Islamic State group in northern Iraq were handed over to Indian authorities in Baghdad to be flown home later Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Remains of Indians Killed by IS in Iraq to Be Flown Home
headline.main: Remains of Indians Killed by IS in Iraq to Be Flown Home

docs.snippet: Factbox on Australian coach Darren Lehmann, who said on Thursday he would be resigning his position after the test series against South Africa in the wake of the ball-tampering scandal:
Swiss pharmaceutical firm Novartis is selling its stake in a consumer health care joint venture with GlaxoSmithKline to the British company for $13 billion.

headline.print_headline: Novartis Sells Joint Venture Stake to GSK for $13 Billion
headline.main: Novartis Sells Joint Venture Stake to GSK for $13 Billion

docs.snippet: Every Asian country now trades more with China than with the United States, often by a factor of two to one. Here’s how the outlines of the rivalry are defining the future of the continent.

headline.main: How China Is Challenging American Dominance in Asia

docs.snippet: Cricket South Africa have confirmed a two-test tour of Sri Lanka In July along with five One-Day Internationals that will provide preparation for next year’s World Cup in England and Wales.

headline.print_headline: Cricket-South Africa to Tour Sri Lanka in July
headline.main: Cricket-South Africa to Tour Sri Lanka in July

docs.snippet: South Africa wicketkeeper Heinrich Klaasen will replace banned Australian Steve Smith in the Rajasthan Royals team for this year's Indian Premier League (IPL), organisers said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: South African Klaasen Replaces Smith in Rajasthan Squad
headline.main: South African Klaasen Replaces Smith in Rajasthan Squad

docs.snippet: Amazon.com Inc may submit an offer https://www.livemint.com/Companies/TsSn1a2CheYUMUvRQeuhRK/Amazon-may-make-rival-bid-for-Flipkart.html to buy Indian e-commerce firm Flipkart, which is currently in talks with Walmart Inc for a stake sale, local d...

headline.print_headline: Amazon May Offer to Buy India's Flipkart: Mint
headline.main: Amazon May Offer to Buy India's Flipkart: Mint

docs.snippet: India on Tuesday withdrew rules to control "fake news" less than 24 hours after announcing them, following an outcry that the regulations could be used by the government to curb press freedom.

headline.print_headline: Factbox: Action by Asian Governments to Crack Down on 'Fake News'
headline.main: Factbox: Action by Asian Governments to Crack Down on 'Fake News'

docs.snippet: SoftBank said Wednesday that it is investigating a shareholder campaign that sought the ouster of former Google executive Nikesh Arora, who had been groomed to lead the Japanese technology company.

headline.print_headline: SoftBank Investigates Shareholder Campaign to Oust Executive
headline.main: SoftBank Investigates Shareholder Campaign to Oust Executive
